control.name: Responsive date
control.helpHtml: Lets the user type or select a date from a calendar. It resizes with screen-width and moves down if it gets too small.

property.name: Name
property.helpHtml: Name that can be given to the control. Names are used to help identify controls uniquely.

property.name: Form summary label
property.helpHtml: Summary label to appear at the end of the form. Leave blank to have the control and its value hidden.

property.name: Label
property.helpHtml: Label to appear above the control

property.name: Value
property.helpHtml: Sets an initial value for the date. The value may be in the current date format (e.g., "26/01/2009"), a number of days from today (e.g., 0, or +7) or a set of values and periods ("y" for years, "m" for months, "w" for weeks, "d" for days, e.g., "+1m +7d").

property.name: Date format
property.getValuesFunction: return [["dd/mm/yy","dd/mm/yyyy"],["mm/dd/yy","mm/dd/yyyy"],["yy-mm-dd","yyyy-mm-dd"],["dd-M-yy","dd-MMM-yyyy"],["d MM yy","Short day, full month"],["DD, d MM, yy","Full date details"]];
property.helpHtml: Sets the date format. Useful for other regions.

property.name: Read-only
property.helpHtml: Whether users are able to enter dates using the keyboard. If not checked additional validation will be required.

property.name: Clearable
property.helpHtml: Whether users are able to clear the date value.

property.name: Min date
property.helpHtml: Sets the minimum date. Dates will be unable to be selected earlier than this date. Valid periods are "y" for years, "m" for months, "w" for weeks, and "d" for days. For example, "+1m +7d" represents one month and seven days from today.

property.name: Max date
property.helpHtml: Sets the maximum date. Dates will be unable to be selected past this date. Valid periods are "y" for years, "m" for months, "w" for weeks, and "d" for days. For example, "+1m +7d" represents one month and seven days from today.

property.name: Year range
property.helpHtml: Sets the range of years that can be selected. For example, "2010:2016" will set the range from the first date in 2010 to the last date in 2016.

property.name: Show other months
property.helpHtml: Displays dates from the next and previous months.

property.name: Select other months
property.helpHtml: Allows you to select dates from the next and previous months.
